outline:
1. to open
    1. (Qal) to open
    2. (Niphal) to be opened, be let loose, be thrown open
    3. (Piel)
      1. to free
      2. to loosen
      3. to open, open oneself
    4. (Hithpael) to loose oneself
  2. to carve, engrave
    1. (Piel) to engrave
    2. (Pual) to be engraved
kjv_def: appear, break forth, draw (out), let go free, (en-) grave(-n), loose (self), (be, be set) open(-ing), put off, ungird, unstop, have vent.
strongs_def: to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
